about_csu.title: California State University System
scrollContent: The California State University (CSU) system is the nation's largest public four-year university network, stretching from Humboldt in the north to San Diego in the south. Its campuses share a commitment to accessible, high-quality higher education that powers social mobility and workforce readiness for Californians.

More than 23 universities, 460,000 students, and 56,000 faculty and staff collaborate through the CSU to advance research, community partnerships, and statewide economic impact. Coordinating technology, infrastructure, and academic innovation across such scale requires shared governance, responsive support, and storytelling that keeps every campus connected.

quiz_intro.title: What would you do?
body: The CSU Board wants to make sure you're aware of the system's biggest risks.
Which challenge must be tackled first to ensure a sustainable ChatGPT rollout across the CSU?

options.label: Campuses Ability to Support
options.description: Most campuses lack trained AI support teams and structure to sustain deployment.

options.label: Blazing Pace of AI
options.description: Frequent new AI features demand continuous security and policy reviews.

options.label: Stakeholders Alignment
options.description: Faculty and leadership need a shared vision before expanding systemwide adoption.

quiz_intro.prompt: Which do you see as the biggest hurdle?

quiz_phase2.title: Emerging Issues in Edu
body: As AI develops, new risks arise in teaching, research, and student well-being.
Which threat should we most vigilantly guard against in an academic environment?

options.label: AI-assisted academic misconduct
options.description: Students or faculty using AI to generate content without attribution—creating new forms of plagiarism.

options.label: AI-induced mental fatigue and sycophancy
options.description: Constant AI use can create dependency—students may seek affirmation from AI instead of feedback from peers or faculty.

options.label: Fake AI-generated research output
options.description: Researchers or bad actors submitting AI-generated papers, false data & citations that compromise academic credibility.

quiz_phase2.prompt: Select the area of highest concern

quiz_phase3.title: Campus Triage
body: The Cal Maritime pilot proved ChatGPT the technical roll-out, scaling to 22 more campuses brings new complexity.
With limited central staff, where should the focus go next?

options.label: Support smaller campuses first
options.description: They adopt quickly and need hands-on guidance, but their small user bases limit overall impact on systemwide adoption goals.
options.outcome: Smaller campuses thrive, but total license utilization lags behind targets.

options.label: Engage large campuses with influence
options.description: They represent the bulk of CSU’s users and visibility, but may resist alignment due to existing AI strategies and governance structures.
options.outcome: High-impact campuses onboard slowly, requiring sustained negotiation and trust-building.

options.label: Form a Coalition of the Willing
options.description: Unite campuses eager to collaborate—strength: shared enthusiasm and momentum; threat: uneven adoption and fragmented governance.
options.outcome: Coalition drives rapid innovation, though policy alignment lags across the system.

quiz_phase3.prompt: Choose how to expand the rollout beyond Cal Maritime

quiz_phase4.title: A Crowded Field for AI
body: The AI landscape is rapidly evolving, with several major players competing for attention and market share. Which do you see as the strongest competitor to OpenAI in the coming years?

options.label: Anthropic’s Claude
options.description: Focused on safety, alignment, and explainability — Claude appeals to institutions prioritizing responsible AI use.
options.outcome: Claude gains traction in education and research circles.

options.label: Google’s Gemini
options.description: Deeply integrated with Google Workspace, Gemini’s strength lies in its ecosystem and reach across productivity tools.
options.outcome: Gemini adoption grows within enterprise ecosystems.

options.label: Microsoft Copilot & Azure AI
options.description: Rather than building its own models, Microsoft leverages OpenAI technology within Copilot and Azure AI, pairing scale with enterprise integration.
options.outcome: Microsoft expands its lead through deep ecosystem integration and enterprise trust.

quiz_phase5.title: The Ripple Effects of AI
body: AI adoption is reshaping higher education in multiple ways — from classrooms to back offices to data dashboards. Where do you expect the biggest impact to be felt first?

options.label: Teaching & Learning
options.description: AI tutors, writing assistants, and adaptive learning tools transform how students engage and how faculty design instruction.
options.outcome: Faculty begin rethinking assignments, feedback, and academic integrity in the age of AI.

options.label: Organizational Efficiency
options.description: Automation and AI copilots streamline workflows — from IT tickets to HR requests — saving time and improving service quality.
options.outcome: Operational tasks accelerate as AI copilots reduce administrative bottlenecks.

options.label: Data & Analytics
options.description: AI-powered analytics surface insights from enrollment data, student outcomes, and resource allocation to guide smarter decisions.
options.outcome: Data-driven decision-making becomes faster, more predictive, and more equitable.

quiz_phase5.prompt: Select the area of biggest impact

quiz_phase6.title: Outlook on AI
body: AI is reshaping nearly every aspect of life — work, creativity, relationships, and learning. How would you describe your overall outlook on this transformation?

options.label: Excited and Optimistic
options.description: You see AI as a powerful force for progress and innovation.
options.outcome: You lean into the possibilities and look for ways to apply them.

options.label: Excited but Cautious
options.description: You’re hopeful about AI’s benefits but mindful of its risks and unknowns.
options.outcome: You explore with curiosity while advocating responsible use.

options.label: Skeptical
options.description: Unsure the hype will live up to the promise.
options.outcome: You observe from a distance, waiting to see real-world value.

options.label: Pessimistic or Bleak
options.description: You worry AI could harm jobs, creativity, or human connection.
options.outcome: You brace for disruption and focus on preserving human touch.
